intro: Agrimonia conopsea, commonly known as the common agrimony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, spiny, cone-shaped fruits. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a serrated edge, often covered in fine pubescence. Agrimonia conopsea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its astringent and anti-inflammatory effects.
